Class javachart.chart.Line 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Class javachart.chart.Line 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----javachart.chart.Line
public class Line
extends Object
This class builds and manages traditional plot lines that consider both X and Y values. Each Dataset assigned to this class is used to draw a single continuous line in a color defined by the Dataset's Gc. If a particular Dataset's Gc also defines an Image, that Image is used for data point markers. If 3-d effects are active, Lines are drawn as ribbons, with an X and Y offset defined by this chart's Globals class. You can also turn plot lines off to use this class for scatter plots.
See Also:
Regress, DiscontinuousLine, LineChart, LabelLineChart

numDataSets

Line(Dataset[], AxisInterface, AxisInterface, Plotarea)

Used by the doLabels method to draw a single data label
doLabels(Graphics)
Used by the doLines method to draw data labels for the entire Line component.
doLine(Graphics, int)
Draws a plotline for a single dataset.
doLines(Graphics, boolean)
Calls doLine and doMarker methods for drawing individual dataset lines and markers, respectively.
doMarkers(Graphics, int)
Draws markers for a single Dataset.

Draws this charting component.

  public void setUseDisplayList(boolean onOff)

Parameters:

getClip 
  public boolean getClip()
Inquires whether this Line is set to clip at Plotarea boundaries
Returns:
True if clipping is active
setClip 
  public void setClip(boolean onOff)
Sets the clipping flag for this Line. If clipping is active, plot lines will end at the Plotarea boundaries. This can be used in conjunction with manual Axis scaling to create a scrolling window of plotting data.
Parameters:
onOff - True to enable clipping
getLabelsOn 
  public boolean getLabelsOn()
Inquires whether this Line will draw labels at each data point
Returns:
True if labels are active
setLabelsOn 
  public void setLabelsOn(boolean onOff)
Turns on Datum labels at each data point. Labels are off by default.
Parameters:
onOff - True to enable data point labelling.
See Also:
Datum
getLabelAngle 
  public int getLabelAngle()
Inquires what angle data point labels will draw at.
setLabelAngle 
  public void setLabelAngle(int num)
Sets the angle at which data point labels should draw. The default angle is 0.
Parameters:
num - degrees of angle
getLabelPrecision 
  public int getLabelPrecision()
Returns the labels' floating point display precision. A precision of 2 yields labels like "1.11". A precision of 4 makes labels like "1.1111"
Returns:
label precision
setLabelPrecision 
  public void setLabelPrecision(int num)
Set the labels' floating point display precision.
Parameters:
num - A new label precision
getLabelFormat 
  public int getLabelFormat()
Returns this Line's label format value.
Returns:
label format
setLabelFormat 
  public void setLabelFormat(int num)
Determines what format to use for this Line's labels. The default is Gc.DEFAULT_FORMAT, which is a machine-dependent representation for Java 1.0x, and may include Scientific notation. Other possibilities include Gc.COMMA_FORMAT, which formats numbers as 1,000.00 and Gc.EURO_FORMAT, which formats numbers like 1.000,00.
Parameters:
i - label format
Returns:
None
draw 
  public void draw(Graphics g)
Draws this charting component.
Parameters:
g - Graphics class to draw
doLines 
  protected synchronized void doLines(Graphics g,
                                      boolean markersOnly)
Calls doLine and doMarker methods for drawing individual dataset lines and markers, respectively.

                        int whichSet)
Draws a plotline for a single dataset. Called by doLines
doMarkers 
  protected void doMarkers(Graphics g,
                           int whichSet)
Draws markers for a single Dataset. Called by doLines.
doLabels

Used by the doLines method to draw data labels for the entire Line component.

                                int whichSet,
